Highlight.summary: The Highlight interface of the CSS Custom Highlight API is used to represent a collection of instances to be styled using the API.

remarks.para: To style arbitrary ranges in a page, instantiate a new Highlight object, add one or more Range objects to it, and register it using the .
A Highlight instance is a Set-like object that can hold one or more Range objects.

HighlightAdd.summary: The add() method of the interface adds a new object to a highlight, to be styled using the {{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightAdd.returns: The Highlight object, with the added range.

HighlightClear.summary: The clear() method of the interface removes all the objects from a Highlight object.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightDelete.summary: The delete() method of the interface removes a specified object from a Highlight object.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightDelete.returns: Returns true if range was already in Highlight; otherwise false.

HighlightEntries.summary: The entries() method of the interface returns a new Iterator object that contains an array of [range, range] for each object in the Highlight object, in insertion order.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightEntries.returns: A new iterator object that contains an array of [range, range] for each Range object in the given Highlight, in insertion order.

HighlightForEach.summary: The forEach() method of the interface executes a provided function once for each object in the Highlight object, in insertion order.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightHas.summary: The has() method of the interface returns a boolean indicating whether a object exists in a Highlight object or not.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightHas.returns: Returns true if the specified range exists in the Highlight object; otherwise false.

HighlightHighlight.summary:
The Highlight() constructor returns a newly created
object which can hold a collection of objects to be styled using the {{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}.

HighlightKeys.summary: The keys() method of the interface is an alias for the method.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightKeys.returns: A new iterator object containing each Range object in the given Highlight, in insertion order.

HighlightPriority.summary: The priority property of the interface is a number used to determine which highlight's styles should be used to resolve style conflicts in overlapping parts. Highlights with a higher priority number have preference over those with a lower priority.

remarks.para: It is possible to create objects that overlap in a document.
When overlapping ranges are used by multiple different objects, and when those highlights are styled using {{cssxref("::highlight")}} pseudo-elements, this may lead to conflicting styles.

If two text ranges overlap and are both highlighted using the {{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}, and if they're both styled using the color CSS property, the browser needs to decide which color should be used for styling the text in the overlapping part.
If no priority is set, all highlights have the same priority, and the browser chooses the most recently registered highlight to style the overlapping parts.

Note that all the styles of a highlight are applied and the browser only needs to resolve conflicts when the same CSS properties are used by multiple overlapping highlights. The highlight style conflict resolution also does not depend on the order in which the {{cssxref("::highlight")}} pseudo-elements rules appear in the source, or whether or not CSS properties are marked as !important.

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightSize.summary:
The size property returns the number of objects in a
object.

remarks.para:
-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightSize.value: The value of size is a read-only integer representing how many entries the highlight object has.

HighlightType.summary: The type property of the interface is an enumerated {{jsxref("String")}} used to specify the meaning of the highlight. This allows assistive technologies, such as screen readers, to include this meaning when exposing the highlight to users.

remarks.para: By default, a highlight object will have its type set to highlight, but you can change it to spelling-error or grammar-error.

HighlightType.value: The possible values of the type enumerated value are:

HighlightValues.summary: The values() method of the interface returns a new Iterator object that contains the values for each Range object in the Highlight object in insertion order.

blockquote.para: The keys() method is an alias for this method. It behaves exactly the same and returns values of Highlight elements.

remarks.para: Highlight is a -like object, so this is similar to using .

-{{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "The CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}
-CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web

HighlightValues.returns: A new iterator object containing each Range object in the given Highlight, in insertion order.
